questions.question: I often ……………………….. horror movies.
questions.description: Use the simple present to talk about habits, routines etc.

questions.question: I ……………………… tomorrow.
questions.description: The present continuous is used to talk about pre-planned future events.

questions.question: They ……………………………. in May.
questions.description: The present continuous is used to talk about pre-planned future events.

questions.question: She ………………………. care of stray dogs and cats.
questions.description: Use the simple present if this is a habit. The present continuous is used to talk about something that we are doing at the moment.

questions.question: I ………………………….. run when I was just one year old.
questions.description: Use could to talk about past ability.

questions.question: You ………………………….. me you weren’t coming.
questions.description: Both expressions can be used to criticize people for not doing things.

questions.question: There ……………………….. be a bakery in that corner.
questions.description: Use used to to talk about past habits and states.

questions.question: She ………………………… talk about her illnesses for hours.
questions.description: Either would or used to can be used to talk about past habits.

questions.question: ‘Where is Samuel?’ ‘He ……………………… to Russia.’
questions.description: Has been is used to talk about finished visits. We use the present perfect to express ideas like these because he is still in Russia.

questions.question: We saw children ……………………….. in the park.
questions.description: After see, we can use an ing form or an infinitive without to.

questions.question: You never let me ………………………… a sentence.
questions.description: Finish is followed by an infinitive without to.
